results.brief_description: Bedlam [computer game]. Bedlam is a top down vertical shooting scroller in a futuristic sci fi setting for one or two players simultaneously. Players pilot a vehicle shooting and dodging aliens and fighting boss ships.

results.title: Demon Stalkers [Commodore 64 & 128]
results.creator_credit: Electronic Arts and Micro Forte Studios
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, code wheel, warranty card & manual (paper booklet) in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description:
Demon Stalkers is an action RPG and editor/construction set game. It is similar to Atari’s Gauntlet. The player can choose either the hero, armed with throwing knives, or the heroine, armed with a crossbow who must travel through ninety-nine mazes before meeting the final demon. The game features different enemies as you progress through the mazes, with clues to progression built in. There is also a two-player co-operative mode. The in-built level editor uses pull-down menus and offers a high level of flexibility. As well as creating actual levels, the player can create an integrated storyline and game world, since the in-game text can also be edited.
The game shipped with a Magic Cipher consisting of three cardboard wheels that, when moved to the correct positions, revealed the passwords were needed to access some of the lower levels of the dungeon. Some of the vital text in the cipher is in a tone of blue that could not be photocopied at that point, making the cipher a basic anti-piracy measure.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/demon-stalkers/

Last accessed: 14/04/2021

Original game developed by Micro Forte Studios for Commodore 64 and 128, published in 1987 by Electronic Arts.

The player can choose either the hero, armed with throwing knives, or the heroine, armed with a crossbow who must travel through ninety-nine mazes before meeting the final demon. results.title: Ready and able
results.brief_description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.
results.description: Members of the CFA provide practical advice on how to prepare for and survive a major catastrophe like a bushfire or a flood. These interviews were conducted in light of the tragic Black Saturday bushfires in February 2009.

group.title: Living with disaster: stories and experiences from disasters

group_siblings.title: When a fire comes to you

results.title: When a fire comes to you
results.brief_description: When the threat of fire hit Lydia Romari’s family, they adopted their fire plan and stayed safe. Unfortunately, it doesn’t erase the frustration, anxiety and horror of the Black Saturday bushfires that devestated much of the Yarra Ranges region in Victoria in 2009.

results.title: Home again
results.brief_description: Kat Hay provides her account of the Newcastle Floods of 2007, from the realisation that it was not an ordinary day to the feelings associated with returning home after everything was destroyed.

results.title: When the flood comes
results.brief_description: The Newcastle floods of 2007 have caused Djibril Ly to reflect on growing up in Mauritania in West Africa. He recalls the devestation of flooding and how this has helped him to prepare for similar events in Australia.

results.title: A Plan to be safe
results.brief_description: Carla Zekas and her family were spending a hot Summer’s day by the river when the dark clouds first emerged. At that moment, the plan changed from staying cool to being safe.
